intro: Bomarea andimarcana subsp. andimarcana, commonly known as the Andean bomarea, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of Ecuador. It belongs to the family Alstroemeriaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at elevations between 1,500 and 2,500 meters. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a smooth texture, while its stems are often hairy. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and potential medicinal properties.
